document_data.name: Khampo
document_data.Geography: It stood amongst the forest in southern Tabot, north of the [[Wu Pi Te Shao Mountains]], on the road between [[Thok]] and [[Pabex]] and at the end of the road from [[Bidnop So]].{{Cite interactive atlas|?}} It was roughly a day's ride from Thok.<ref>{{Cite dungeon/8/The Flowers of Flame|49,50}}
document_data.History: In {{YearlinkConvert|2607|SY}}, Baron [[Phen Do]] of Khampo rebelled against the government of Tabot. In response, the worried Mag-chi Le-Khung (the military office) stationed three divisions in Khampo to contain the revolt. In {{YearlinkConvert|2607|SY}}, a tortoise-shell divination at [[U'Chan Gompa]] suggested burning rocks would fall on Khampo during Qwa'chein Goh celebrations; they elected not to warn the city, as punishment for its rebellion.<ref name="KT78" > Despite this, that same year, in response to a [[Phutan]]ese army assembling at the border, Tabot went on a war footing, with the Mag-chi Le-Khung mustering soldiers in the area. They ordered conscription in Bidnop So, [[Darka]], Thok, and Khampo. In short, it was not a good year for the people of Khampo.<ref name="KT77" >
document_data.Inhabitants: * Baron [[Phen Do]], a rebellious aristocrat of Khampo
